oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Return of provisions received and issued at at Camp Wright in Shelbyville, Tennessee
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: While TSLA houses an item, it does not necessarily hold the copyright on the item, nor may it be able to determine if the item is still protected under current copyright law. Users are solely responsible for determining the existence of such instances and for obtaining any other permissions and paying associated fees that may be necessary for the intended use.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: United States -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865; Tennessee -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865; Armies -- Commissariat; Operational rations (Military supplies); Cookery, Military; Confederate States of America -- Army -- Camp Wright
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Return of provisions received at Shelbyville for May 1863. List includes date, voucher number, names of quartermasters from whom goods were received, and types and quantities of goods received, including pork, beef, bacon, flour, candles, rice, coffee, sugar, vinegar, soap, and salt. Report submitted to Richmond, Virginia, June 16, 1863.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Confederate States of America -- Army -- Subsistence Bureau
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Early Confederate Army regulations created the Office of Subsistence to procure subsistence stores for the army through contracts. The Commissary Department was in charge of all food or subsistence supplies at a military post. The storehouses used by the Assistant Commissaries of Subsistence were provided by the Quartermaster's Department.
